H0.text: What Greek mythological figure, who apparently cut quite the figure, was doomed to waste away staring at his own reflection. Adonis

H1.text: What Greek mythological figure, who apparently cut quite the figure, was doomed to waste away staring at his own reflection. Endymion

H2.text: What Greek mythological figure, who apparently cut quite the figure, was doomed to waste away staring at his own reflection. Tithonus

H3.text: What Greek mythological figure, who apparently cut quite the figure, was doomed to waste away staring at his own reflection. Narsosis

A4.text: According to the best-known version of the story in Ovid's Metamorphoses, Narcissus rejected the advances of all women and men who approached him, instead falling in love with his own reflection in a pool of water.

A5.text: Narcissus fell deeply in love with his own reflection, his first and only love, and killed himself because he could not have his object of desire.
